cluster_relations.rel_desc: People around the world are described as having imagination that is captured by urban legends.
cluster_relations.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that a subject possesses a psychological or sociocultural characteristic (e.g., imagination, fears, values) that is relevant to the interpretation or transmission of urban legends.
cluster_relations.subject_class_label: Story and Legend Audiences (including Cautionary Narratives)
cluster_relations.object_class_label: Psychological and Cultural Constructs of Urban Legends

qualifiers.ConditionExpression: when they encounter or hear urban legends
qualifiers.OtherQualifier: PsychologicalState: mental capacity engaged by urban legends

cluster_relations.rel_desc: People around the world are described as having curiosity that is engaged by urban legends.
cluster_relations.canonical_rel_desc: Links an entity (typically a person or group) to a psychological or mental attribute it exhibits.
cluster_relations.subject_class_label: Story and Legend Audiences (including Cautionary Narratives)
cluster_relations.object_class_label: Psychological and Cultural Constructs of Urban Legends

qualifiers.ConditionExpression: when they encounter or hear urban legends
qualifiers.OtherQualifier: PsychologicalState: desire to know more stimulated by urban legends

cluster_relations.rel_desc: Cultural groups have specific interests that influence tales.
cluster_relations.canonical_rel_desc: Links a group or entity to a defining or typical characteristic it possesses (e.g., interests, fears, values).
cluster_relations.object_class_label: Psychological and Cultural Constructs of Urban Legends

cluster_relations.rel_desc: Cultural groups possess distinctive fears that are reflected in tales.
cluster_relations.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that a subject possesses a psychological or sociocultural characteristic (e.g., imagination, fears, values) that is relevant to the interpretation or transmission of urban legends.
cluster_relations.object_class_label: Societal Fears and Anxieties in Legends

args.canonical_rel_desc: Links a person, group, or audience to a psychological or sociocultural attribute it possesses (e.g., imagination, curiosity, fears, values, interests) that is relevant to the interpretation or transmission of urban legends.
args.justification: All four relations connect people or cultural groups to psychological or sociocultural attributes (imagination, curiosity, fears, interests) in the context of urban legends. They currently use slightly different canonical_rel_name and rel_cls variants for the same semantic pattern. Normalizing to a single predicate 'has_psychological_or_cultural_attribute' and a unified class 'psychological_sociocultural_attribute_relation' improves schema consistency while keeping the broad group ATTRIBUTE unchanged.

executed_decisions.canonical_rel_desc: Links a person, group, or audience to a psychological or sociocultural attribute it possesses (e.g., imagination, curiosity, fears, values, interests) that is relevant to the interpretation or transmission of urban legends.
executed_decisions.justification: All four relations connect people or cultural groups to psychological or sociocultural attributes (imagination, curiosity, fears, interests) in the context of urban legends. They currently use slightly different canonical_rel_name and rel_cls variants for the same semantic pattern. Normalizing to a single predicate 'has_psychological_or_cultural_attribute' and a unified class 'psychological_sociocultural_attribute_relation' improves schema consistency while keeping the broad group ATTRIBUTE unchanged.
